resource.chars:
And [equation not transcribed]
retaining only the terms which will 
be required.
When the proper substitutions are made, the terms 
involving cosines destroy each other, as in the usual theory,
and by equating to zero the terms involving the sines 
we obtain 
[equations not transcribed]
<s>Also equating to zero the nonperiodic terms, we 
have for a first approximation, neglecting d2(1/a)/dv2 and 
putting m’=m
[equations not transcribed]<\s>
